title: Part A Point 1
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria or to score the response.

To earn this point, responses must demonstrate the following:

  • Prints the original text if the text length is longer than the width of the column

Canonical Solution: 

if (text.length() > colWidth) 
{
   System.out.println(text);
}
else 
{
   System.out.print("|");
   int padding = (colWidth - text.length()) / 2;
   for (int i = 0; i < padding; i++) 
   {
      System.out.print(".");
   }
   System.out.print(text);
   int pos = padding + text.length()
   for (int j = pos; j < colWidth; j++) 
   {
      System.out.print(".");                
   }
   System.out.println("|");
}
descriptions:
The response does not earn the point.

Responses will not earn the point if they

  • make any incorrect call to a String method
  • use an incorrect comparison

The response earns the point.

Responses will not earn the point if they

  • make any incorrect call to a String method
  • use an incorrect comparison

title: Part A Point 2
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria or to score the response.

To earn this point, responses must demonstrate the following:

  • Identifies the number of periods needed before and after the text

Canonical Solution: 

if (text.length() > colWidth) 
{
   System.out.println(text);
}
else 
{
   System.out.print("|");
   int padding = (colWidth - text.length()) / 2;
   for (int i = 0; i < padding; i++) 
   {
      System.out.print(".");
   }
   System.out.print(text);
   int pos = padding + text.length()
   for (int j = pos; j < colWidth; j++) 
   {
      System.out.print(".");                
   }
   System.out.println("|");
}
descriptions:
The response does not earn the point.

Responses can still earn the point if they

  • incorrectly determine the length of the text

The response earns the point.

Responses can still earn the point if they

  • incorrectly determine the length of the text

title: Part A Point 3
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria or to score the response.

To earn this point, responses must demonstrate the following:

  • Prints string in appropriate format with identified number of periods before and after the text (algorithm)

Canonical Solution: 

if (text.length() > colWidth) 
{
   System.out.println(text);
}
else 
{
   System.out.print("|");
   int padding = (colWidth - text.length()) / 2;
   for (int i = 0; i < padding; i++) 
   {
      System.out.print(".");
   }
   System.out.print(text);
   int pos = padding + text.length()
   for (int j = pos; j < colWidth; j++) 
   {
      System.out.print(".");                
   }
   System.out.println("|");
}
descriptions:
The response does not earn the point.

Responses can still earn the point if they

  • print an incorrect number of periods before and after the text

The response earns the point.

Responses can still earn the point if they

  • print an incorrect number of periods before and after the text
